attributes.action: commission a separate independent review of banking culture
attributes.background: The City regulator, the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA), has shelved plans for an inquiry into the culture, pay and behaviour of staff in banking. The government can't intervene in day to day operations but it can instruct it's own review so let's petit
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-35204010

attributes.action: Remove the blanket ban on term time holidays.
attributes.background: Rather than banning pupils from authorised term time absence, head teachers should exercise discretion. Wales has removed this conflicting ban and Westminster should seriously reconsider and repeal the ban.
attributes.additional_details: 93% of all school absence is a result of truancy and only 7% of all school absences are a result of a family taking a term time holiday. Term time holidays are often the only time a lower earning income family can afford to go on holiday. If schools need to avoid holidays during a particular term due to assessments, then they are advise parents that these terms no such absences are permitted. The systems needs more flexibility to meet the needs of a modern working family.

attributes.action: Hold a vote to find out if the country wants a second EU referendum
attributes.background: The Leave campaign has distanced itself from their pre-referendum statements, has no post referendum plan and many people who voted out have changed their mind. We, the undersigned feel that this would be the only democratic route to gauge opinion and offer a way to unite the country once again.

attributes.action: Allow Medicinal Cannabis (Savitex) for all neurological conditions in the UK.
attributes.background: The Welsh NHS have authorised the use of Savitex medicinal cannabis for MS sufferers only in Wales to treat muscle spasticity. However, there are many people in the UK with other neurological conditions such as Cervical Myelopathy and Myelomalacia who also suffer with severe muscle spasms.
attributes.additional_details: There is no magic cure for muscle spasms. There are certain medicines such as Gabapentin, Pregabalin, Baclofen ect but many patients do not benefit from them orally. To treat severe muscle spasms, many patients are offered the insertion of a Baclofen Pump instead. A recent cost analysis by the MS Foundation has found that it is cheaper to prescribe Savitex than insert and regularly maintain a Baclofen pump. Savitex trials have proved positive in reducing muscle spasms. Please support our campaign - it is cost effective. MS sufferers are allowed the drug why can't all people suffering with neurological conditions in the UK have access to it ?

attributes.action: Call a UK referendum on what our new relationship with Europe should be.
attributes.background:
A referendum is now required to clarify the position of the people of the UK with regards the pending  negotiation of the UK's future relationship with the EU. An outline proposal 
1: Tariff-based trade as non EEA member
2: EEA membership subject to EU rules
3: Full EU membership

attributes.action: Referendum on the Terms of a Bill of Rights before Assent to Leave the EU
attributes.background: The EU Referendum set citizen versus citizen. The EU guaranteed Fundamental Rights. Hillsborough & Stafford show it was left to Citizens to enforce the most basic of Rights - to Life & for Justice. Government & MP's knew but failed - Year after Year. We cannot allowed such rights to be ignored.
attributes.additional_details:
Leaving the EU requires a further treaty before Parliament. It should NOT BE passed without the fundamental rights of each UK citizen GUARANTEED first.

Mr Gove's plan is for a BILL OF RIGHTS to abolish the Human Rights Act when most citizens cannot enforce any current rights. 

RIGHTS TO BE TAKEN AWAY should be subject to REFERENDUM before the Act of Leaving. Limit their power to hurt YOU, your Family, & Fellow Citizens. SOVEREIGNTY means the MP is the servant and not the Master

Remind them.

attributes.action: Offer British citizenship to Polish nationals resident in the UK on June 23 2016
attributes.background: The Polish people are longstanding & valued friends and allies of the UK, and we have deep ties which exceed and excel any EU links. We hereby petition the UK Government to extend an offer of automatic British Citizenship to all Polish nationals resident in the UK on June 23rd 2016.
attributes.additional_details:
We deeply regret the sense of insult felt by the Polish nation resulting from the referendum decision to leave the EU. We wish to repair our relationship. We wish to recognise the outstanding contribution to peace of the Free Polish Army, and to reassure the UK's widespread, well integrated, Polish-heritage communities, which in many cases pre-date the formation of the EU. 

http://www.bbc.co.uk/history/familyhistory/bloodlines/migration.shtml?entry=polish_free_forces&theme=migration

attributes.action: Remove the titles Mrs, Miss and Ms from all government forms.
attributes.background: Titles for women are sexist and discriminatory, and provide marital status information about them that men do not have to divulge. Even having the Ms option gives some people a preconception about that person. All titles fields should be removed from document and computer forms.

attributes.action: Make rear facing law till 2
attributes.background: As research shows its 10x safer for a child to be rear facing up to 2 sometimes 4 unfortunately a lot of people are to quick to put their babies into forward facing at 9+ months which in an accident can have devastating consequences! Whereas rear facing children will more than likely have a bruise

attributes.action: Ban MMA and regulate the beauty industry with checks from local councils
attributes.background:
MMA causes injuries and health problems. Beauty therapists are not currently checked for accredited qualifications, insurance and hygiene.
This has led to numerous reports of injuries and litigation that could be avoided with regular checks and a formal register.

attributes.action: Make food producers include corn/additives derived from corn in allergens info
attributes.background: I'm 51 with multiple food allergies. Corn allergy can cause reactions ranging from anaphylaxis to headaches and stomach problems. A list of things to avoid is 4 sheets of A4 paper long. In order to shop/eat I need to carry it with me. Life with corn allergy is difficult but could be so much easier.

attributes.action: Stop UK Gap Year travel companies placing volunteers in orphanages abroad.
attributes.background:
1. 80% of children in homes in Asia and Africa are NOT orphans.
2. Short-term volunteers disrupt the welfare of the children.
3. It is illegal in many countries to volunteer on a Visitor's Visa.
4. Many orphanages force children to convert from their family religion in return support.
attributes.additional_details:
These conditions violate the terms of the UN Convention on the Rights of the Child to a home, family, community, religion.
http://www.nextgenerationnepal.org/File/The-Paradox-of-Orphanage-Volunteering.pdf
http://globalsl.org/why-unicef-and-save-the-children-are-against-you-caring-for-orphans/
http://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/jan/02/cambodia-child-protection-workers-call-for-end-to-booming-orphanage-tourism
http://www.theguardian.com/global-development-professionals-network/2016/may/16/volunteers-stop-visiting-orphanages-start-preserving-families

attributes.action: Force County Councils to allow residents to use their closest recycling center
attributes.background: Many County Councils require proof of residency before allowing them to use their recycling centers. This forces people to travel extra distances to avoid crossing county borders to recycle. It is bad for the environment and councils should be forced to co-operate to limit this environmental damage.
attributes.additional_details: Residents of Sandhurst could travel a 6.6 mile round journey and use the Camberley recycling center. Surrey County Council are now not allowing cross county border use and as a result these residents are having to travel a 13.6 mile round journey to the Bracknell recycling center. This causes extra environmental damage and increased road use. This type of policy is in force in many areas of the country and should not be acceptable as a simple agreement between councils could stop this lunacy.

attributes.action: Postpone the EU referendum until David Cameron has negotiated an exit agreement.
attributes.background: It seems to be an unfair situation for the public to make such an important decision without truly knowing what an exit would cost. A strong leader should have negotiated terms for both staying in the EU and leaving. We will then be able to calculate the true cost of leaving or staying in the union.
attributes.additional_details: David Cameron spent only a short time negotiating with Europe about staying in the union. Another period of the same length should be spent negotiating terms for leaving the union. This might work in favour of the UK. Businesses would research all avenues for the best solution for them, this would help them make informed financial decisions. Recently the Conservative's published that £1 paid to the EU Equals £10 recieved. Maybe £0 paid will return £9, Nobody knows. Let's negotiate and find out.

attributes.action: Stop HS2. Instead, invest in a more beneficial option such as UK ultraspeed.
attributes.background: HS2 is designed to be an engine for growth. It will cost £43 Billion. Maglev technologies are an excellent alternative to HS2 that will help to connect many more people within the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
- Maglev technology will allow travel from London to Glasgow via Birmingham, Manchester, Liverpool, Leeds, Teeside, Newcastle, Edinburgh and more, yet cost only £30BN
- Maglev trains travel at over 300mph compared to 170-200mph for conventional wheel on rail trains.
- Maglev trains are capable of faster acceleration/deceleration, can travel up steaper inclines, and the nature of the platform on which they travel means that they take 92% less land.

See http://www.500kmh.com/maps.html for more information on the original project. This is in no way affiliated with 500kmh.com, however, the site is an excellent source, clearly showing how the technology could benefit the UK.

attributes.action: Educate and enforce pornography awareness in schools
attributes.background: I believe adolescents need to be educated on how pornography can affect their emotional and physical state. Many young people are viewing it without knowledge or awareness of how it could be harming them or others.This generation have a right to know the dangers of porn addiction and abuse.
attributes.additional_details:
http://fightthenewdrug.org/

http://www.roadtograce.net/current-porn-statistics/

http://yourbrainonporn.com/physiological-and-psychological-effects-modern-day-pornography-2013

http://www.webroot.com/gb/en/home/resources/tips/digital-family-life/internet-pornography-by-the-numbers

attributes.action: Help make it illegal for kids to have Smartphones under 12 yrs old to stop abuse
attributes.background: I believe that children under the age of 12 (at least) should only be able to have phones that can make a simple telephone call or simple text (without pictures) to prevent the abuse that is a growing problem using social media.
attributes.additional_details: I read in the national papers and hear from parents of their children and the problem in keeping them off their mobile telephones, there is enormous social pressure for a smart phone for kids which is not a healthy device at early ages I believe and want support to change the law.

attributes.action: Stop Granting Migrants Citizenship and Help Our Own First!
attributes.background:
1)Migrants that want to be British Citizens should need to have either a high intelligence or trade our country needs. 
2)Migrants to be required to provide evidence of enough money to survive for 2 years and a job prepared. 
3)They shouldn't be allowed to claim ANY benefits for the first 5 years.
attributes.additional_details: Britain used to be a strong and powerful country, but this is no longer the case. British citizens believe we should help our people before we offer help to Migrants . We feel let down due to: 1) lack of housing, 2) lack of jobs, 3) cuts to medical care, 4) education spending cuts, 5) cuts to policing, 6) cuts to military, 7) increase in tax cost for the working class 8) lack of humane care for the elderly. We feel this wouldn't be the case if the Government had put US first and not Migrants!

attributes.action: Close our borders to stop an Islamic State attack occurring in London.
attributes.background:
We should close our borders after the recent Paris and Brussels attacks to prevent similar attacks in London.

After the recent attacks London does not want a repeat of the 7/7 attacks. Neither does any major city in the United Kingdom. If you agree, please sign this petition.

attributes.action: Provide the Air Training Corps with a glider fleet fit for purpose.
attributes.background:
The Air Training Corps has operated from 1941 offering young people across the UK a wide range of opportunities and has enriched thousands of lives in the process.

The decision to vastly reduce the glider fleet will have a massively detrimental effect on the opportunities offered.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.parliament.uk/business/publications/written-questions-answers-statements/written-statement/Lords/2016-03-10/HLWS591/

attributes.action: Ban the use of retractable dog leads exept on beaches or fields away from roads.
attributes.background: There isn't a day goes by where I almost wrap a dog around the wheels of my car because the owner fails to retracts the lead enough to stop the dog wandering into the road. I'm a dog owner, I love animals, walk them on a retractable lead by all means, but do it away from traffic and risk of death.
attributes.additional_details: Some people may be unable to let their dog off lead, and want to give the feeling of freedom to their believed animal, this is understandable. However it's not only death or seriously injury to the dog which is at stake, a car swerving and avoiding the dog could cause harm to pedestrians and other road users, this has happened to me many times but luckily I've avoided any harm.  I know someone who's dog was killed when his wife used a retractable lead on a residential street, it's avoidable.

attributes.action: Not to issue 12 month ban on drug driving offences with cannabis
attributes.background: Smokers who have given up smoking for a particular career can lose the opportunity of having a career if stopped and tested by the police. Each person's metabolism system is different to the next person & cannabis stays in your system for 28 days or longer.
attributes.additional_details: A person who used to smoke can be banned if cannabis is still present within their system if tested. This also leads to a loss of job which will put further pressure on a person as well as loss of finance and stability.

attributes.action: Give the Meningitis B vaccine up to the age of 18!
attributes.background: I myself had meningitis B at the age of 18. So it is not just babies and young children that can get it. I thought I had been vaccined for meningitis at the age of 11 in primary school but it was meningitis C, so I believe all ages should also be given the meningitis B vaccine.

attributes.action: The refugee crisis distorts views on the EU. Postpone the referendum now.
attributes.background: We are in a very different place to that when the Tory referendum promise was made. The refugee crisis has deepened severely over the last year. Ignorance of all facts fuels many people's thoughts on why we should leave the EU. Time is being wasted debating this - time that should be used to help.
attributes.additional_details:
Hundreds of thousands of people heading for Europe.
European countries blockading borders.
Tear gas, water cannons and riot police used against people fleeing persecution and death.

attributes.action: Can the UK have a memorial for the 763 plus Soldiers  killed  Northern Ireland
attributes.background: Ex- Soldier who served 4 tours in NI and lost 5 good friends over there. I have seen memorials for WW1 WW2, The Falklands war and today the unveiling of one for the first Gulf War. It is as if we are being ignored.

attributes.action: Amend the Science Museum Group's mission, to promote its museums in the regions
attributes.background: It should be an obligation of the SMG to enable access to understanding about science, the media and the other themes of the Group to as wide a population as possible.  In particular, it should be required to maintain its regional museums to the same standard as any within London.
attributes.additional_details: I was prompted to begin this petition by the decision of the SMG to remove 400,000 photographs to London from the National Media Museum in Bradford, to scrap the Bradford Film Festival and to rename - and effectively downgrade - the NMM.  It is unacceptable that London, which is only 13% of the UK's population, is sucking the cultural life from the rest of the country. The regions deserve better; indeed, the regions deserve parity with London.

attributes.action: Stop the violations of the British national‘s human rights abroad
attributes.background: The UK Government refuses to support British nationals abroad, even in case of fundamental violations of human rights, when the British national has evidence of a denial of justice. Although in 1999 the Parliament has set out Government policy on this issue (Hansard 16 December 1999, Column 254W).
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government ignores Parliament's decision and this endangers the safety of British nationals abroad. 
The existing mechanism of protection of British nationals abroad needs some improvements, because millions of Britons every year travel abroad for tourism, business and humanitarian purposes and some of them at any time may become victims of fundamental violations of human rights. 
The UK Government must support British nationals in such situations.

attributes.action: Save Stoke-on-Trent train station to keep it where it is!
attributes.background: The transport department want to move Stoke-on-Trent train station to Etruria, this means we loose our beautiful historic building with its period features forever in exchange for an ugly modern purpose built building. This cannot happen!
attributes.additional_details: http://m.stokesentinel.co.uk/8203-Stoke-station-relocate-multi-million-pound/story-28736564-detail/story.html

attributes.action: Give suspects of sex crimes anonymity until conviction
attributes.background: Innocent men can have their lives and reputations completely destroyed by getting falsely accused of sex crimes, as the experiences of Mark Pearson, Lord Bramall and Louis Richardson have recently shown. Suspects should be given the same right to anonymity that their accusers enjoy.
attributes.additional_details:
If a particular offender is suspected to be a serial rapist, a Judge could waiver his anonymity to allow more victims to come forward. However in many cases the openness of the information allows innocent people to have their names tarnished, their careers ended and to experience psychological trauma. 

Victims are given anonymity due to the particular stigma associated with sex crimes; this stigma also applies to the suspect.

attributes.action: Build a modern, functional, UK Parliament on Salford Quays, Greater Manchester
attributes.background: The Government is proposing to spend £7bn refurbishing a crumbling, antiquated Parliament in central London which is difficult to get to from the rest of the UK. Salford is in the geographical centre of the UK, less than one mile from the UK Motorway system and with excellent public transport links.
attributes.additional_details: This is an opportunity to have a 21st Century purpose built Parliament as they have in Scotland and Wales. Land is available by the Manchester Ship Canal and Government offices could be built on the Industrial Estate in Trafford Park. The cost could be covered by selling Government offices in Whitehall. There is an excellent local source of unskilled labour for the project when under construction and in use. Local leisure facilities are excellent with many hotels, restaurants and bars near by.

attributes.action: The Financial Ombudsman Service is unaccountable and should be scrapped ASAP!
attributes.background:
Relying on the FOS will probably result in disappointment and frustration. Worse is that it could be one of the biggest financial mistakes you'll ever make. 
Why? Well the answer lies with the paymasters. As the saying goes, "a dog doesn't bite the hand that feeds it"!
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.financial-ombudsman.org.uk/faq/answers/research_a5.html

https://www.opendemocracy.net/ourkingdom/financial-ombudsman-and-its-service

http://www.financial-ombudsman-problems.co.uk/

attributes.action: Stop the benefit cap going down below £500 a week
attributes.background: Stop the government lowering the benefit cap below £500 a week
attributes.additional_details: People cannot cope as it is... If the benefit cap is lowered as planned for April 2016 I'm frightened to think what will happen to families.

attributes.action: We, the undersigned, call upon the Government to proscribe campaign group Cage
attributes.background:
Following the comments made by campaign group Cage about the Litvinenko murder, we believe the time has come for the Government to give serious consideration to banning them.
Cage made previous comments calling Daesh murderer Mohammed Emwazi a "sweet beautiful man" which caused a public outcry
attributes.additional_details:
The group Cage has previously found itself at the centre of a furore when it described Emwazi, aka "Jihadi John" a "sweet beautiful man".
They also claimed ,without producing any evidence, that British security services were partially responsible for radicalising Emwazi.

attributes.action: Put a price cap on train tickets until services are substantially improved
attributes.background: I get the train into London everyday and experience delays every single day. Regardless of the daily inconveniences I see the train prices increase so that I know pay just under £5,200 per year for my ticket.
attributes.additional_details: For example, on Monday my train was twenty five minutes late with no explanation as to why. Yesterday I was delayed by one hour forty minutes because of a fault at two different stations. This morning I was fifteen minutes late, again with no explanation as to  why. I have also experienced a number of occasions where trains no longer stop at the usual stations in an attempt to get themselves running back on time because they were delayed which hugely inconveniences the majority of customers.

attributes.action: Make the speed limit in country lanes considerably lower or add speed humps
attributes.background: I am a car driver and horse rider, I think 60mph or sometimes no speed limit stated is very dangerous for both drivers and horse riders! There has been various collisions between various cars and sometimes horses! These have been fatal in some circumstances!
attributes.additional_details: Usually country lanes lacks clear view of the oncoming road however drivers will not take this into consideration and slow down! I have witnessed collisions between vehicles, equines and livestock! Horse riders, drivers, livestock and equines are at risk of injury or fatality! This can be prevented by simply adding speed humps or placing a speed limit on these dangerous roads!

attributes.action: A full enquiry into G4S management of all youth and custody services.
attributes.background: Following Panorama documentary that detailed the abuse and torture of our most vulnerable kids, a full enquiry is needed into how abusive culture is being allowed to exist within G4S Medway and justice for kids being abused there.  A fully investigation into the management of all G4S services.

attributes.action: Hold 2nd EU referendum, allowing 16 & 17 year olds in Scotland to vote.
attributes.background: The Scottish referendum and EU referendum are linked. 16 & 17 yr olds were allowed to vote in the Scottish referendum. Scotland's position as part of the UK is now uncertain based on the Brexit result. Today's 16 & 17 year olds should be given the same rights to defend their future as in 2014.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-36616028

2nd Scottish independence referendum likely: http://www.theguardian.com/politics/2016/jun/24/alex-salmond-second-scottish-independence-referendum-is-certain

http://indy100.independent.co.uk/article/how-old-people-have-screwed-over-the-younger-generationin-three-charts--W1AA_n4nEb

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/06/26/scottish-independence-has-nearly-60-per-cent-support-poll-finds/

attributes.action: Stop the UK Government leaving the EU without consent from Scottish Parliament.
attributes.background:
Brexit politicians misled millions of voters on immigration, funding, the NHS, and the economic impact of leaving the EU.

We the undersigned call on David Cameron and Nicola Sturgeon to ensure the views of the Scottish people are represented and cease the process of leading the UK out of the EU.
attributes.additional_details: Scotland has to agree to the UK leaving the EU in order for Brexit to go ahead. A second referendum is extremely unlikely. The best chance we have of stopping the UK proceeding with leaving the EU is for the Scottish Parliament to refuse to give formal legislative consent.

attributes.action: Formal identification required to sign petitions for Parliament to consider.
attributes.background: The Petitions sign on procedure to be changed to that like 'passenger information checks' on aircraft, in so far as formal identification be required for the petition to be accepted. UK Passport, or similar identification that proves the signatory is eligible, and to prevent fraud.
attributes.additional_details:
We have seen petitions are being fraudulently signed by people from all over the world on UK petitions, in particular in reference to the request for another referendum.

Anyone signing a petition MUST be legally eligible to do so, and the current system is being abused extensively and illegally. Having a formal system in place would not only prevent fraud, but where fraud does occur would offer the opportunity to take legal action against those concerned and maintain democracy.

attributes.action: Referendums must garner over 50% in all four nations of the UK to be passed
attributes.background: Referendums risk the break-up of the United Kingdom, if the four nations vote in different ways, as devolved parliaments can cite "material changes" that allow a referendum of independence in their respective nations to be carried out.
attributes.additional_details:
The United Kngdom is a valued but vulnerable Union. The U.K. Parliament must respect the views of the constituent nations when consulting the public over constitutional matters. Therefore, referendums must require the support of each constituent nation (England, Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland). 

The undersigned wish this to be enforced retrospectively, including the recent EU referendum.

attributes.action: Give all teenagers aged under 18 on 23.6.16 a vote in a supplemental referendum.
attributes.background: Allowing teenagers to vote in a supplementary EU referendum will be good for the future of Britain’s democracy, because whatever the final outcome they will have had the opportunity to participate in the decision. Their votes can be added to the June ballot and the result recalculated.

attributes.action: Free University Education for English students now that we are leaving the EU.
attributes.background:
For too long we English students have been forced into paying ridiculous tuition fees for university. The Scottish, Welsh and EU students have their education free while we study almost drowning in debt. 

We have now voted to LEAVE the EU and hence can control how we pay for our education.
attributes.additional_details: The EU students can now be classed as international students making them pay for their education and with the surge of money, which supposedly isn't being spent on the EU membership fees, we english students should receive a free higher education.

attributes.action: Create an independent state in Exeter, Devon and apply to join the EU.
attributes.background: Exeter people voted over 55% to remain in the EU.  Exeter is a thriving aspirational city with a very bright future has an expanding population.  Exeter has a bright future within EU, a distinctive culture and a world renowned food and produce heritage as well as a magnet for international business.

attributes.action: Match the money and resources currently invested in Cornwall by the EU.
attributes.background:
As part of the EU Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly benefited from The Cornwall and Isles of Scilly Growth Programme. This is currently worth €603,706,864 of EU funding.

The government must match the value of this funding after leaving the EU and ensure the continuation of its current projects.
attributes.additional_details:
Please refer to:
http://www.erdfconvergence.org.uk/growth-programme

attributes.action: Europeans in the UK for more than 10 years should be given British citizenship.
attributes.background:
We need to demonstrate that leaving the EU will not develop xenophobic reteric in the country,which can not be controlled.
There are lots of Europeans who are keeping this country running, in the health services and caring professions who are scared they will be kicked out due to the result.

attributes.action: Increase public spending by £350 million per week as the Leave campaign promised
attributes.background: Government to increase direct spending on public services by £350,000,000 per week in real terms by the end of 2018, without increasing taxes, as the Brexit Leave campaign promised.

attributes.action: Guarantee a minimum extra £100m per week invested into the NHS.
attributes.background:
'Vote Leave' have successfully won the EU Referendum and we can expect the UK to start proceedings to withdraw from Europe. 

'Vote Leave' campaigned with assurances that the money we are currently handing over to the EU could be better spent on our own public services.
attributes.additional_details:
Now that 'Leave' have won this referendum they need to live up to the promises made during the campaign and guarantee that this money will be spent on public services that greatly need extra support. 

"Let's give our NHS the £350 million the EU takes every week" was a specific slogan of the 'Leave' campaign. The 'Leave' campaign website also stated "Vote Leave to invest an extra £100m into the NHS every week".

These were explicit statements made during the campaign and many people have voted on the back of such promises made. The government needs to ensure that any negotiations out of the EU also includes assurances that funds currently paid to the EU be reinvested into our public services and specifically into our underfunded NHS.

attributes.action: David Cameron should not invoke Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty immediately
attributes.background: The UK has voted to Leave the EU. The vote is not legally binding and UK Parliament is sovereign. David Cameron does not have to invoke article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty, giving our intention to leave the EU immediately. He should use the Leave vote as a negotiating tool and then hold a 2nd referendum

attributes.action: Ban the slaughter of all animals and sale of meat and dairy in the UK
attributes.background: The farming and slaughter of animals is barbaric and cruel. The consumption of meat and dairy is unsustainable for the planet. Large areas of land and forest are being destroyed globally. Animals are sentient beings who deserve the same rights as the humans they share the Earth with.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.livescience.com/27692-deforestation.html

attributes.action: A motion of no confidence be brought against this government.
attributes.background: A motion of no confidence be brought against this government for misleading and lying to the general public over Britex.
attributes.additional_details: Half of the government say that the other half is not telling the truth, so it must be true that at least one half is not telling the truth according to our own elected representatives
